title: I can't get back from card view to the default.
content: Using Thunderbird 115.1.0, I clicked on the icon top right of the screen and selected card view to see what it looked like. I now need to return to the normal view but the icon has disappeared, so how do I do it?

title: thunderbird
content: Hi I am running Thunderbird 115.1.0 (64 bit) on windows10 and it keeps asking for my password on the email server. Despite ticking the remember me box, it doesn’t. The same problem does not occur when my wife says an email from her address. Please help me. What am I doing wrong? Thank you. Mike Barker, a pensioner.
creator: mikebarker17

title: wrongly created a POP account, then created an IMAP account
content:
Hello

wrongly created a POP account, then created an IMAP account to a Microsoft Office 365 account. Now I cannot stop de Pop account from downloading all the messages from may server and the IMAP account is giving this error: " Login to server smtp.office365.com with username d784@dei.uminho.pt failed." and I cannot send messages form the IMAP account.

Can you help?

I have windows 11 Home

title: Missing mailboxes in "Grouped folder"
content:
Hey there,

i need help with Thunderbird 115.1.0 (64-Bit) which is the latest update for me after checking it. I am using the grouped folder featured and it's very handy to me. But i am missing two of my mailboxes here. In the Inbox they are all grouped. Please take a look on the picture. The numbers are associated with each mailbox and are obfuscated for privacy reasons.

Thanks in advance! :)

title: Automatic spell checker
content:
Hi, I'd like to turn on automatic spell checking. I am using Thunderbird 115.1.0 (64-bit) in the United Kingdom

I found a post saying Options > Options >Composition > 'Spelling' tab

However I can't even find the OPTIONS tab.

Help appreciated.

title: Abrir mensajes desde notificación
content: Yo tengo desactiva la "VISTA PREVIA DE MENSAJE" que el atajo de teclado es el "F8", cuando me viene un mensaje nuevo y me muestra la notificación, se abre en "VISTA PREVIA DE MENSAJE" obligándome a volver a cerrarlo con "F8", es comportamiento se puede cambiar para que me lo habrá en otra "VENTANA", como pasa con el resto cuando lo abro en la aplicación.

title: I can't add outlook.com accounts
content:
I cannot add any outlook.com accounts to Thunderbird. It says I have been locked out. I tried both IMAP and POP but both failed. I can sign into my accounts any other way on phone or browser. I added all gmail and yahoo accounts and they worked fine

Thank you

title: Moving WLM folders to Firefox.
content: I am in the process of migrating from WLM to Firefox and I cannot seem to get the IMPORTEXPORT TOOL to work. I am on Firefox 115.1.0 under Windows 10 and I followed the link to download IMPORTEXPORT TOOLS 3.3.2 SM+TB. Following the Q+A topics I may not be alone with this problem! Is there a work around that I could use? Thanks in advance Jim Alexander (Australia)
creator: alexanderjim

title: Migration of Thunderbird on Win11, with mail on D: drive, to Linux Mint - Filters lost
content:
After using Thunderbird, since the good old days when it was released on 3.5" floppy disks!!, I have a moderately complex set up. A small C: drive forced me to move my mail file to D: a while ago. My mail is in D:\ThunderbirdMail and my profile is in %APPDATA%\Roaming\Thunderbird\profile.ini

profiles.ini contains:

start of file --------------

[Install8216C80C92C4E828] Default=D:\ThunderbirdMail Locked=1

[Profile2] Name=Ian Hobson IsRelative=0 Path=D:\ThunderbirdMail

[Profile1] Name=default IsRelative=1 Path=Profiles/jgtvh4wi.default Default=1

[Profile0] Name=default-release IsRelative=1 Path=Profiles/x1ua9znr.default-release

[General] StartWithLastProfile=1 Version=2

end of file -------------

Judging from the dates on the Profiles directory, I am using x1ua9znr.default-release.

I have tried many times to move the mail to Linux mint, and I usually get the mail to appear, in the right folders. However I am still missing the filters. As you can imagine after using Thunderbird so long, I have many filters and I don't fancy entering them in again by hand. The details appear to be in "D:\ThunderbirdMail\ImapMail\imap.googlemail.com\msgFilterRules.dat".

If I knew where to put this file so that Thunderbird will pick it up, the job would be complete.

Thanks for your help Ian
creator: ian191

title: Ability to download emails suddenly stopped
content:
ADDENDUM: Emails are now downloading again! All I did was delete a few hundred emails from folders in the vain hope that might help. Noted that the error console reported something wrong with server? Anyway, seems to have resolved with the passage of time perhaps?

Yesterday my Thunderbird's ability to download emails seemed to suddenly stop. It seems to 'see' that there are emails to download in that the menu bar at the bottom of the window will come up with 'Downloading message 1 of 31' but then it will sit there for a minute or so, then disappear. The activity manager records 'No messages to download'. I've been through the checklist of items to review when this happens and have tried deleting of the global messages thingy from Thunderbird library etc., but no change.

I can send messages.

My internet provider webmail is working and I can see download my emails there so at least I have that ability. However, I prefer to have my Thunderbird app where I can organise and read messages offline and online.

I have the latest version of Thunderbird (102.14.0 [64-bit]). I use a MacBook Air with OS Ventura 13.4.1. I have no anti-virus programs and no firewall.

Can anyone help? Thanks!
creator: thewordygecko

title: Tbird 115
content: I generally run a KDE environment with LEAP (SuSE). I see that Gnome has been listed as "preferred". How much support or problems will there be with TBird 115 with KDE?
creator: wylbur
